def give_sum(arr):
    # Initialize a variable to store the sum of the array elements
    sum_value = 0
    
    # Initialize a counter variable q to iterate through the array
    q = 0
    
    # Use a while loop to go through each element in the array
    while q < len(arr):
        # Add the current element to the sum_value
        sum_value += arr[q]
        
        # Increment the counter to move to the next element
        q += 1
    
    # Return the total sum of the array elements
    return sum_value
```

This function uses a while loop to iterate over each element in the array, adding its value to `sum_value`. The loop continues until `q` is no longer less than the length of the array, ensuring that every element has been processed. After the loop completes, `sum_value` contains the total sum of all elements in the array, which is then returned.
